result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 08:21 AM Defendant Tavion J Harris Barton in court by zoom video with attorney Peter M Wolff, in person.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty. Wolff
Hearing on June 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.

08:48 AM Defendant Tavion J Harris Barton appeared by Zoom with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Attorney Wolff states this is a waiver and he was told it was sent by his office.  The Court is not in receipt of a waiver.  The Court will adjourn this matter and set it for a waiver of the prelim.  If the waiver is filed timely then the Court will allow for the defendant to appear by Zoom at the next date.  If the waiver is not timely filed, the Court orders the defendant to appear in person.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

01:45 PM Defendant Tavion J Harris Barton in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has no objection to reinstating bail.  Court reinstates the signature bond.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.
